Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of North Ionian, probably Clazomenian, black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior: moulded ring at junction of neck and shoulder; below, black-figure decoration consisting of female figure (head with white flesh and black hair remaining) to right; on either side of figure, undetermined decoration.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.095) (phase 3)
